means: 篡夺，霸占( usurp的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_cn: 那杂志盗用了版权为他人所有的素材.

sentence.Network_en: The expression'social engineering'has been usurped by the Utopianist without a shadow of light.
sentence.Network_cn: “ 社会工程”这个词已被乌托邦主义者毫无理由地盗用了.

sentence.Network_en: Henry IV usurped the throne of England.
sentence.Network_cn: 亨利四世篡夺了英国的王位.

list.abs: 第二目窃取公司机会(usurped corporate opportunity) 29第三目报酬 30第二款忠实义务之法律效果 30第二项注意义务(duty of care.
He became so ambitious that he finally plotted to usurp the throne ., 他的野心越来越大 , 最后甚至密谋要篡夺皇位.
He usurped my rights ., 他侵占了我的权利.
but you must not allow it to usurp a disproportionate share of your interest但你不应让它过多地占据你的兴趣

entry.def: If you say that someone usurps a job, role, title, or position, they take it from someone when they have no right to do this.

example.ex: Did she usurp his place in his mother's heart?...
example.tran: 她取代了他在他母亲心目中的地位吗？

example.ex: The Congress wants to reverse the reforms and usurp the power of the presidency.
example.tran: 议会企图颠覆改革，夺取总统权力。

means.word_mean: 1. (used especially of the rights of another) seized and held by force;

sentences.sentence: "the usurped crown sat heavy on his head"

auth_sentence.content: Thus cars usurped the place of horses in our hearts.
auth_sentence.res_content: Thus cars usurped the place of horses in our hearts.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Thus cars usurped the place of horses in our hearts.

auth_sentence.content: Hatshepsut had usurped her stepson's throne.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Hatshepsut had usurped her stepson's throne.

auth_sentence.content: Suddenly Madeleine's happiness diminished, usurped by the feeling of peril.
auth_sentence.res_content: Suddenly Madeleine's happiness diminished, usurped by the feeling of peril.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Suddenly Madeleine's happiness diminished, usurped by the feeling of peril.
